responses: The name of the college is Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College.
Our college is known as Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College. You can find more details on our website: https://bcrec.ac.in/.

patterns: head the Compurte Science & Engineering department?
responses:
Here are the HODs of various departments:- Civil Engineering: Dr. Sanjay Sengupta
- Mechanical Engineering: Dr. Chandan Chattoraj
- Electrical Engineering: Dr. Susanta Dutta
- Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE): Dr. Narendra Nath Pathak
- Computer Science and Design (CSD): Dr. Raj Kumar Samanta
- Computer Science and Engineering (CSE): Dr. Arindam Ghosh
- Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science): Dr. Chandan Bandyopadhyay
- Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AIML): Dr. Gour Sundar Mitra Thakur
The principal of Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College is Dr. Sanjay S. Pawar, Ph.D.

Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College has a strong placement record. Major recruiters include Accenture, IBM, Infosys, Wipro, Cognizant, Capgemini, Jaro, Koyo, Indus Net, TCS, and others. In 2023, the average package for Computer Science and Engineering students was INR 3.80 Lakh, with the highest package reaching INR 14.00 Lakh.

patterns: Are there any financial aids for students?
responses:
Scholarships offered include:
- Tuition Fee Waiver (TFW) Scheme: For economically backward meritorious students.
- West Bengal Financial Scheme (WBFS): For economically backward meritorious students.
Eligibility criteria include academic merit, family income, and category-based considerations.

patterns: What facilities does the college provide?
Are there hostels and sports facilities?
responses:
Facilities include:
- Academic: Well-equipped classrooms, laboratories, and libraries.
- Sports: Football ground, cricket playground, basketball court, multi-gym.
- Recreational: Music room, canteen, food court.
- Hostel: Four large hostels.
- Others: Auditorium, bank, and online class facilities.

patterns: How can I apply to the college?
responses: Admissions are based on WBJEE or JEE Mains ranks. The process involves entrance exams, counseling, document verification, and fee payment. For more details, visit the admission section on our website: https://bcrec.ac.in/.

patterns: How much is the semester fee?
responses:
Fee structure per semester (without hostel):
- CSE/IT/ECE: ₹71,050
- EE/ME/CE/CSD: ₹67,050

With hostel:
- CSE/IT/ECE: ₹1,06,050
- EE/ME/CE/CSD: ₹1,02,050

Dr. B.C. Roy Engineering College has a strict anti-ragging policy. The college has an active Anti-Ragging Committee and organizes awareness programs to prevent ragging. Students can report incidents to the Anti-Ragging Committee or college authorities.

patterns: Is there a uniform for students?
responses:
Dress code:
For Men: Navy blue trousers, light blue shirt, emblem-emblazoned green/yellow/black ties, black formal shoes. Navy blue blazer in winter.
For Women: Navy blue salwar and light blue kameez or trousers and shirts, emblem-emblazoned green ties, black formal shoes. Navy blue blazer in winter.

Sports facilities include:
Indoor: Gymnasium, table tennis.
Outdoor: Football field, cricket ground, basketball court, volleyball court.
Annual events: Annual Sports Meet, Inter-Departmental Tournaments.

patterns: How many students are admitted per branch?
responses: Seat availability varies each year. For accurate details, visit the official website: https://bcrec.ac.in/ or contact the admission office.

patterns: How can I contact the college?
phone number for the admissions office?
responses: You can reach us at our official email: info@bcrec.ac.in or call us at +91-6297128554.Feel free to email or call us during office hours. We're here to help!

patterns: Do you have any clubs or societies?
responses: Our campus is vibrant and full of life! We have cultural events, tech fests, sports meets, and more. You'll never run out of things to do!

patterns: How I check my exam dates?

patterns: Is there a canteen on campus?

responses: Yes, we have a canteen that serves a variety of dishes, including vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. It's a favorite spot for students!
The canteen is open on weekdays and weekends until 8 PM. Perfect for those late study sessions!

The Coding Club is perfect for programming enthusiasts. We host coding contests, hackathons, and workshops on trending technologies like AI and blockchain.

patterns: What does the Photography Club do?
responses: The Photography Club is for students who love capturing moments. We organize photo walks, workshops, and competitions.

patterns: What does the Music Club do?
responses: The Music Club brings together singers, instrumentalists and music enthusiasts. We perform at cultural fests and host open mic nights.

patterns: What facilities does the library offer?

Do you have e-books or online resources?

patterns: What are the accreditations of this college?
responses: Yes, the college is approved by AICTE, accredited by NBA, and holds NAAC accreditation.

patterns: Which university is BCREC affiliated with?
Is the college affiliated with MAKAUT?
affiliated university of Dr. B. C. Roy Engineering College?
responses: Dr. B. C. Roy Engineering College is affiliated with Maulana Abul Kalam Azad University of Technology (MAKAUT), West Bengal.

patterns: Does BCREC have a management department?
about the courses available in the college
responses: The college offers programs in various departments, including Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Information Technology, and Management Studies.

patterns: What does it mean to be an autonomous college?
responses: Yes, Dr. B. C. Roy Engineering College is an autonomous institution affiliated with MAKAUT, West Bengal. This status allows the college to design its own curriculum and conduct its own examinations while being affiliated with the university.

patterns: about the solar plant in the college
Does BCREC have an SPV power plant?
responses: Yes, the college has a Solar Photovoltaic (SPV) Power Plant, which contributes to sustainable and renewable energy usage on campus.

patterns: Can I access Wi-Fi in the hostel?
responses: Yes, the campus has Wi-Fi facilities available for students and staff. The service is accessible in classrooms, hostels and other key areas to support academic and personal needs.

patterns: Are there events held in the auditorium?
What is the capacity of the auditorium?
responses: BCREC has two auditoriums, namely the Nazrul Manch and a fully equipped mordern AC−Auditorium named “Dulal Mitra Auditorium.” Apart from that, the Institute also has one Seminar Hall named Albert Einstein Hall. The Albert Einstein Hall is fully air−conditioned and synchronized with sound systems and projectors facility for conduct of guest lectures, seminars etc. Nazrul Manch is an open air auditorium that accommodates over 900 students for cultural activities, fests etc.

patterns: about the medical facilities in the college
Does the college have medical facilities?
Is there a hospital or clinic on campus?
What happens in case of medical emergencies?
responses: The college maintains a Medical Unit to provide medical aid to students under the expert supervision of our experienced resident physician in collaboration with The Mission Hospital, Durgapur. The MoU with The Mission Hospital provides for a Doctor positioned at the College premises from 12 noon to 5pm. Provision for ambulance services for admission in The Mission Hospital is available for 24 hours. In addition, a college car is always stationed for any medical emergency of any student during College hours and even beyond.

patterns: Is there a bank on campus?
Where can I withdraw cash on campus?
Are there banking services in the college?
responses: The campus has AXIS Bank ATM and SBI ATM that provide 24 hrs. ATM Banking facility apart from the fully operational SBI Bank branch within the premises to facilitate monetary transactions for students and faculty alike.
